front.title: Use cases for DDoS Open Threat Signaling

abstract.t: The DDoS Open Threat Signaling (DOTS) effort is intended to provide a protocol to facilitate interoperability across disparate DDoS mitigation solutions and services. This document presents use cases which describe the interactions expected between the DOTS components as well as DOTS messaging exchanges. The purpose of describing use cases is to identify the interacting DOTS components, how they collaborate and what are the types of information to be exchanged.
